conclusion: Use Faraday's Law of Electromagnetic Induction to find the magnitude of the induced EMF in the coil.
The formula for induced EMF in a rotating coil in a uniform magnetic field is given by: \( \mathcal{E} = n B A \omega \sin(\omega t) \).
Definitions of variables: \( n \) is the number of turns, \( B \) is the magnetic induction intensity, \( A \) is the area of the coil, \( \omega \) is the angular velocity, \( t \) is the time.
Calculate the area \( A \) of the coil: \( A = l_{AB} \times l_{BC} = 0.2 \, \text{m} \times 0.5 \, \text{m} = 0.1 \, \text{m}^2 \).
Substitute the given values into the formula for the induced EMF: \( \mathcal{E} = n B A \omega \sin(\omega t) \).
Timing starts when the coil plane passes through the neutral plane, at \( t = 0 \), \( \sin(\omega t) = \sin(0) = 0 \).
Maximum induced EMF occurs when \( \sin(\omega t) = 1 \).
Calculate the maximum induced EMF: \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{max}} = n B A \omega \).
The magnitude of the induced electromotive force in the coil is \( \mathcal{E}\)
